title.content-text: 1.2.4 - Switches for Small and Medium Sized Business (SMB)

brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts an activity in which you identify the hierarchical model layers (Access, Distribution, or Core) and the switch feature with which it is associated. Some features may belong to more than one layer.

Hierarchical Layers:
A: Access
B: Distribution
C: Core

Switch Features:
One. Bandwidth aggregation.
Two. Fast Ethernet / Gigabit Ethernet.
Three. Gigabit Ethernet / 10 Gigabit Ethernet.
Four. High forwarding rate.
Five. Layer 3 support.
Six. Port security.
Seven. Power over Ethernet (P o E).
Eight. Quality of Service (Q o S).
Nine. Redundant components.
Ten. Security policies, access control lists.
Eleven. Very high forwarding rate.
Twelve. V LAN's.
